Summary

Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic. ~ Arthur C. Clarke

I use the latest technology to creatively make people's lives better.

Focussing most of my efforts on writing JavaScript + NodeJS apps that run anywhere (Mobile/Tablet/Desktop/Smart-TV).

Interestes: Almost All Technology, Cyber Security, Business/Data Intelligence, Lean Startups and User Experience.

Certified Salesforce Force.com Developer
Certified ScrumMaster (Agile Alliance)
Experienced in automating/simplifying (business) processes.

In the past I've written Python, PHP, Ruby, Java, C/C++ and Apex+VisualForce
Experience building/scaling both SQL + NoSQL ("Big Data") Databases.

  • Search

    Thomas Cook
    August 2014 – February 2015 (7 months)London, United Kingdom

    Search is the single most used feature of any travel website; all journeys start with a great search experience. I am responsible leading the team ensuring search moves from good to great @ThomasCookUK

  • Lead Developer / Intrapreneur

    Pearson plc
    August 2013 – July 2014 (1 year)London, United Kingdom

    Co-developed a social/collaborative learning platform (from scratch) used by thousands of secondary school students and teachers.

    Highlights:
    - Lean Customer Development (understanding the problems Learners & Teachers face)
    - Rapid prototyping and testing ideas/MVP with real users weekly and responding to feedback.
    - Minimalist mobile-first HTML5 app (Responsive Design)
    - Borrowed many ideas from existing social networks and applied them to learning environment (much higher engagement with young users as our app looked/felt familiar not too "boring" or "cartoonish" - common complaints in education-focussed applications)
    - Focussed on great UI and reduced feature set to solve specific problems.

    - Tech used: Node.js, MongoDB and WebSockets for real-time/reactive interaction.
    - UI Framework: Ratchet - http://goratchet.com/components
    - Focus on usability over more features

    Groupon

  • Junior Graphic Designer, Printers Assistant, Delivery Boy, Tea Maker

    Modern Graphics
    April 1998 – August 2002 (4 years 5 months)Lisbon Area, Portugal

    Modern Graphics was the Publishing/Printing firm Co-Founded and Managed by my Father when I was growing up. At its peak there were over 120 staff producing printed material for major banks, government and other publishing houses.

    I was lucky enough to get to hang out there after school while I waited for my dad to finish his 16 hour days ...

    In 2000 while visiting my older sister - who had just left home for University - in London I purchased (and voraciously read) Rich Dad Poor Dad by Robert Kiyosaki and a lightbulb went off in my head; working for *Free* was the best way to Learn!

    I tried to learn everything I could about the publishing/printing industry from initial client meetings (I got to be a fly on the wall in a few meetings aged 16!) to graphic design (Using Corel Draw and Adobe InDesign/Photoshop) right the way down to typesetting, printing, binding/finishing and deliveries.

    It was the kind of Money-Cant-Buy Experience I hope to give other kids some day.

Volunteer Experience & Causes

  • Co-Founder, Board Member and Treasurer

    D'Eynsford Tenant Management Company (CIC)
    September 2011 – Present (4 years 4 months)Social Services

    The D'Eynsford Tenant Management Organisation (TMO) Community Interest Company (CIC) is a Project started and run by local residents of the D'Eynsford Estate in Camberwell, London.

    The purpose of the the TMO is to improve the lives of all those who in and around the estate by proactively managing the services the residents rely on.

    I am honored to be involved in the initiative because it gives all residents a voice in community decisions and provides people the opportunity to learn how to run a (Social Enterprise) company for the benefit all, which I feel is *infinitely* harder than just trying to maximise profits.

    For more info on the D'Eynsford TMO see: http://deynsford.org/tmo/
    If you live in London / SE5 and want to get involved in your community visit: www.se5forum.org

A preview of what LinkedIn members have to say about Nelson Kenneth:

  • Since joining Founders & Coders Nelson has been an excellent mentor to me and the other members. He always provides his insight and experience on both technical and practical questions and encourages us to formulate our own perspective and understanding. His focus on User Experience, Test Driven Development and Metrics-driven Decision Making have become part of the DNA of Founders & Coders.
  • Nelson is a fantastic worker, it was a joy to work with him on a key internal product at News UK. He constantly exhibited creative flair, passion and desire to enable delivery of the product. His technical capability is vast and understanding of the node.js software platform is significant. He was responsible for the development of a considerable amount of the products user interface, that is exposed to all News UK employees. Importantly Nelson does not shirk from any challenges and the complexity of developing any user story provided to him.
